meanings.definition: An imaginary line drawn around the earth equally distant from both poles, dividing the earth into northern and southern hemispheres.
meanings.sent1: The equators mark the halfway point between the North Pole and the South Pole.
meanings.sent2: Sailors use the equators to navigate and understand the different hemispheres.
meanings.sent3: The equators decided to throw a party at the center of the world!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the equators, dividing his heart into two equal parts.
meanings.sent5: The equators, like a giant belt, encircle the earth in a hug of balance.

meanings.definition: A circle dividing a sphere or other surface into two equal parts.
meanings.sent1: The equators on the globe show where the sphere is divided into two equal halves.
meanings.sent2: The equators on the basketball split the surface into two symmetrical sections.
meanings.sent3: The equators on the pizza made it easy for everyone to get an equal slice.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like the equators, dividing her face into perfect halves.
meanings.sent5: The equators on the mirror reflected a perfectly divided image back at her.
